frameDefinitions: A Manner describes general or specific characteristics of an event in one of three ways:  First, it can refer to how a Comparison_event transpires, absent the influence of an entity (e.g. 'the way you talk').
A Ratifier responds to a Proposal constructed by another party to make it binding over the Ratifier's jurisdiction or constituency.
An Agent makes use of a Means (either an action or a (system of) entities standing in for the action) in order to achieve a Purpose.
An Entity meets the pre-conditions for participating in an Event.
A stretch of linguistic discourse or a Text that a Communicator produces has a Topic that it is about.
A Behavior is classified as entrenched for a Protagonist or a Society.
frameExamples: He completed the task in a fervent <t>manner</t>.
The <t>ratification</t> of the Kyoto protocol has been a long, hard slog.
The primary <t>means</t> of gas detection is mass spectroscopy .
Conductor software gives us the hands-on <t>capability</t> to provide updates immediately
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Comparison_event</fen> is the principal event being characteriszed by the <fen>Manner</fen>. The <fen>Manner</fen> of this <fen>Comparison_event</fen> is often used in comparison with the <fen>Foreground_event</fen>.
The <fen>Salient_entity</fen> that is associated with or directly responsible for the <fen>Comparison_activity</fen>.
The description of the <fen>Comparison_event</fen> or <fen>Comparison_activity</fen>.
A description of the <fen>Manner</fen>.
The <fen>Salient_entity</fen> conducts or engages in the <fen>Comparison_activity</fen> that is being described.

The individual or body that confirms a Proposal negotiated or created by another party, causing it to become binding in a jurisdiction represented by the <fen>Ratifier</fen>.  In the case of direct democratic ratification, the jurisdiction and the <fen>Ratifier</fen> are the same.
The idea or course of action proposed by another individual or body which the <fen>Ratifier</fen> endorses and makes binding.
The <fen>Time</fen> is when the <fen>Ratifier</fen> makes the <fen>Proposal</fen> binding.
The <fen>Place</fen> is where the <fen>Ratifier</fen> ratifies the <fen>Proposal</fen>.
The Agent uses the Means to acheive a Purpose.
The action performed by the Agent.
The goal or purpose of the Agent.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Agent</fen> uses the <fen>Means</fen>.
The <fen>Entity</fen> whose meeting or falling short of pre-conditions is assessed.
The <fen>Event</fen> that the <fen>Entity</fen> may participate in.
The time at which the <fen>Entity</fen> is capable of the <fen>Event</fen>.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is what a <fen>Text</fen> is about.
A set of propositions that is coherent in being about a <fen>Topic</fen>
The <fen>Communicator</fen> is the person who has produced a <fen>Text</fen> on a <fen>Topic</fen>.
The time at which the <fen>Communicator</fen> produces <fen>Text</fen> on a <fen>Topic</fen>.
This Frame Element marks expressions that indicate the entrenched <fen>Behavior</fen>.
This Frame Element marks expressions that indicate whose entrenched <fen>Behavior</fen> is at issue.
This role marks expressions that indicate a region where the <fen>Behavior</fen> is  entrenched.
listRoleExamples: If <fex>we</fex> ratify Management 's plan , we 'll have to take a drug test every week !
President Aleksander Kwasniewski ratified <fex>protocols to the Europol Convention</fex>.
White House voices doubts about Aristide's ability <fex>to govern</fex>
In his book, <fex>Smithers</fex> discusses cotton production.
<fex>His</fex> custom was to come here for the 10 o'clock service.

We can help , you to meet Egyptian people and learn about 
<fex>Egyptian</fex> customs.
They found that a loca custom <fex>in the country</fex> was to walk around barefoot at all times of the year and in all weathers .

sourceCandidateSpans.text: the tens of millions of dollars
